translated: Jātaka🔽The Collection of Middle-Length Texts🔽The Chapter on the Interior
The Jātaka of the Pig in the Hole

analyzed: varam varam tvam nihanam pure cari
translated: “You used to live in a hole in the past,

original: Balaṁ nu te byaggha na cajja vijjati”.
analyzed: balam nu te byagdha na cajja vijjati
translated: But your strength, tiger, is not what it was.”
“These pigs used to wander around in all directions,
Now they’ve gathered together and live in one place,
“I pay homage to the assembled Sangha,
Seeing this, I say this amazing thing:
Where the pigs conquered the tiger’s fangs,
They were freed from the strength of the fangs through unity.”
The Jātaka of the Pig in the Hole, the third.
